intro: Paepalanthus moldenkeanus, commonly known as the yellow rush, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, cylindrical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in spikelets, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in wet, marshy environments and is often found in coastal areas or along riverbanks. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations to saline and waterlogged soils.
